docs.text: a hotshot lawyer gets an obviously guilty child molester acquitted , and shortly after during the victory celebration gets offered an opportunity to show his prowess in new york city .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the lawyer , kevin lomax ( keanu reeves ) is not offered a job yet , he is asked to simply pick a jury .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he accepts .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the jury he selects work out well and before long he is offered a job with the firm .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: making his decision easy is the fact that not only is he offered big money , but a gorgeous apartment .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he convinces his wife , mary ann ( charlize theron ) to make the move to new york .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the first case given to him is a big test ; a " winless " case concerning a man who sacrifices animals in his basement .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the charge was health code violations and kevin once again shows his skill and earns an acquittal .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his new boss and partner in the firm , john milton ( al pacino ) is quite impressed and takes kevin under his wing , explaining many of his philosophies on law , women and sex , and angles the promise of a blissful , wealthy life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kevin's next case is a dream case , given to him by milton himself ( much to the chagrin to his colleagues ) , defending a triple murder suspect who has had a history of problems with the law .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although kevin's career is taking off , his home life is not doing very well .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mary ann is starting to have numerous problems .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she is experiencing severe depression over kevin's long hours , and before long is having horrible dreams and hallucinations of people turning into ghouls , their faces becoming horribly disfigured .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kevin does not help matters by dismissing his wife .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he does not spend more time with her as he explains to milton that he needs to spend as much time on the case as possible to get it over with , then focus all of his attention on his wife .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not helping matters is the fact that kevin is having ideas about a possible affair with a sexy lawyer ( connie nielson ) also working with the firm .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mary ann falls deeper into her madness as kevin spends more time away from home .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kevin eventually looses control of his life and has to institutionalize his wife , and gets disturbing news from his mother ( judith ivey ) about the mystery concerning the identity of his father .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he also starts to lose control of his case .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kevin learns that all of his problems have been caused by the work of one man .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that man is his boss , mr . milton , a truly evil character who just may be the devil himself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kevin must somehow confront milton and thwart whatever diabolical plan he has in store .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but how do you defeat the devil ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: why is it that most courtroom scenes in the movies are absurd ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: do filmmakers really believe that " normal " courtroom drama doesn't fit the bill and they have to juice them up ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the courtroom scenes in this movie would never happen in a real courtroom , which wouldn't have been too bad if it weren't keanu reeves trying to pull it off .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i give reeves credit for trying hard , but throughout the movie i never saw the kevin lomax character , just an actor trying very hard to play kevin lomax and coming up short .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: charlize theron defines the term " over-the-top " in her performance as mary ann lomax , a disappointment in contrast to her good performance in " 2 days in the valley " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the only good performance in the movie is by al pacino , but i kept asking myself what the heck he was doing in this mess ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: maybe he felt it would be interesting playing the devil , and you can tell he is having fun doing so , but his skill as an actor cannot save the poor performances and lackluster script that surround him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's pretty standard stuff , including the fact that the hotshot lawyer appears to be the only competent person on the planet who can do anything right in the courtroom .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: please read no further if you do not want the ending spoiled , but i have to get something off of my chest .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in 1986 i remember watching a movie called " wisdom " with emilio estevez and demi moore , and the ending of that film did the worst possible thing that a movie could do .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what i like to call " guess what , it was all a dream " scenario .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in " wisdom " the two lead characters are killed at the end , only to have one of the characters " wake up " from an apparent and say " gosh , i'm glad that didn't really happen ! " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i considered it inexcusable the way the audience was toyed with .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well , the same thing happens in " the devils advocate " , and although arguments could be made surrounding whether it was actually a dream ( perhaps milton went back in time to try a different route for his plan , since it failed and he is the devil ) , but the point is that the last 90% of the film didn't happen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i know it's a stretch , after all it is a movie and nothing really happened , but i just get annoyed to get toyed with like that .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course , the dream ending could almost be forgiven if the story that precedes it was at least an interesting one .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as i recall , " wisdom " was a decent film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " the devil's advocate " is not .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the devils advocate
docs.label: negative
